meanings.definition: A sign or warning of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were portents of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was a portent of the upcoming winter season.
meanings.sent3: The chirping of the birds in the evening served as a cheerful portent of a pleasant day ahead.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor saw the red sky at night as a portent of fair weather on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The howling of the wolves in the distance was a haunting portent of danger lurking nearby.

meanings.definition: An indication or omen of something about to happen.
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing their path was considered a portent of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The sudden silence in the room was a portent of an impending announcement.
meanings.sent3: The broken mirror was seen as a humorous portent of seven years of bad luck.
meanings.sent4: The shooting star streaking across the sky was a portent of wishes about to come true.
meanings.sent5: The distant rumble of thunder served as a portent of the approaching storm.
